p: Patients who received retreatment had a higher risk of DR-TB, which was consistent with the results of previous studies [ 43, 44]. TB patients with drug-related hepatotoxicity were more likely to have DR-TB, similar to previous observations from other studies [ 45]. Moreover, farmers were at risk for DR-TB. Farmers had poor accessibility to TB-related healthcare as they lived in remote mountainous areas with poor economic status [ 46], increasing the risk of developing DR-TB.
